info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:55PM EDT until April 6 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western Pennsylvania, including the following counties, northern Beaver and southwestern Lawrence.
* WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported numerous road closures due to flooding. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Following roads are closed: - PA351 near Little Beaver - Mercer Road in Franklin Township - Hartzell School Road in Marion Township - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaver Falls, Ellwood City, Patterson Township, Big Beaver, New Beaver, West Mayfield, Ellport, Koppel, Wampum, New Galilee, Enon Valley, Darlington, Eastvale and Homewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT SUNDAY
